content:
Searching for something else, I've stumbled upon this page
https://forge.rust-lang.org/archive/release-history.html

Other than this page, is there a "canonical" site to check releases and changelogs (in addition to the github release view)?

@apiraino The GitHub releases is probably the most canonical. https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/releases

At some point in the last year I believe @Pietro Albini wrote a script to sync releases with that and it backfilled the older releases.
yeah, we should probably remove that forge page...

I may be sentimental and feel sorry to hide Graydon Hoare's announcements on the mozilla mailing list :-) but I can submit a quick oneline diff on forge and comment that out.

maybe adding a redirect to github's release page in case someone still queries that link
Maybe just add a message at the top that github's release page is the new location?
yeah, that would also work. I was just more oriented to removing unused index items (the side view of the table is pretty detailed)

(the side view of the table is pretty detailed)

What table was this comment referring to?
Do you mean the sidebar on the left-hand side of the site?
(which I thought was the “index”, but then I’m back to wondering what “table” means.)
no idea why I wrote "table" when I meant the side index on the left :-)
